body:
Raising a kid without a gender is going to fuck them up mentally. And I think it’s very toxic. I can’t even imagine the type of identity issues they are going to grow up with.

I think children should be raised as their gender assigned at birth. Like if ur a boy you should be raised with typical boy stuff. If the child deviates then that should be accepted but they still need that default gender role presented to them. Almost as a benchmark

Let the child enjoy whatever they enjoy however. If you’re raising a boy and despite being raised masculine they are showing interest in feminine things then let them and celebrate it. Like if they wanna wear dresses, paint their nails or play with barbies. Like fuck it if they like it they like it

Or if a girl is raised feminine but then shows interest in masculine hobbies, trucks or clothes then that shouldn’t be shamed and should be accepted. just because tomboys and tomgirls exist doesn’t mean kids should be raised without gender however. Just because transgender kids do exist doesn’t mean raising kids with gender is wrong

It’s like there’s no one in the middle ground. Like yeah harsh gender roles forced on to a kid is bad and harmful if they don’t like it. Kids that don’t follow typical gender roles shouldn’t be shamed or bullied. But it doesn’t mean gender roles should be forgotten or that they are bad. Doesn’t mean gender roles aren’t important to society

body: I don't get this whole raising children with a gender role. My little sister grew up with 3 male brothers and she still does all the little girl stuff, she puts any possible thing to sleep at every angle of the house. It's not like we ever forced anything on her, actually she might have had more male examples... To grow a child neutrally you'll have to force the neutrality on him I think, which is not the right approach imo

Like if they wanna wear dresses, paint their nails or play with barbies. Like fuck it if they like it they like it

Or if a girl is raised feminine but then shows interest in masculine hobbies, trucks or clothes then that shouldn’t be shamed and should be accepted. just because tomboys and tomgirls exist doesn’t mean kids should be raised without gender however. Just because transgender kids do exist doesn’t mean raising kids with gender is wrong

It’s like there’s no one in the middle ground. Like yeah harsh gender roles forced on to a kid is bad and harmful if they don’t like it. Kids that don’t follow typical gender roles shouldn’t be shamed or bullied. But it doesn’t mean gender roles should be forgotten or that they are bad. Doesn’t mean gender roles aren’t important to society
post.title: Choosing to raise a child without a gender should be considered child abuse

body:
It is though. You probably never realize it when you are completely comfortable or fit the stereotypical roles of a man/woman.

When you’re a child that is outside of the norm. Like I was a feminine boy growing up. I loved playing house, I loved pink and girl stuff. Gender is in your face all the time. You do things and get responses from people about why you are doing 

Gender is an extremely important factor and place of identity. To young children gender is extremely important. I’d say gender at least growing up was the large way children identified themselves.

body:
I disagree, to an extent. I think the child should be told they're a boy or whatever they're born as. But they should choose their interests. If I have a son sure before he can choose I'll buy him a football, or some construction stuff, but also a kitchen toy, cause those are fun.

Then he can choose what he likes. And if he wants to wear a skirt one day, sure why not. He's still a boy

body:
I, a male, liked Barbies as a child, the clothes and the fact you could change them was so cool to me! Plus you could make then fuck each other, so that was cool too! In all the mindless Football Throwing Leonardos and Space Explorin' Raphs, there was Barbies, just living a normal life. My family joked and teased me to no end for asking for a Barbie for Christmas one year. In hindsight it was terrible for them to do that...especially since I love fashion.  
  
I agree with this post. Glad to see the wall coming down. Should there be an age to reach before gender can be switched or hormones started?

I think children should be raised as their gender assigned at birth. Like if ur a boy you should be raised with typical boy stuff. If the child deviates then that should be accepted but they still need that default gender role presented to them. Almost as a benchmark

Let the child enjoy whatever they enjoy however. If you’re raising a boy and despite being raised masculine they are showing interest in feminine things then let them and celebrate it. Like if they wanna wear dresses, paint their nails or play with barbies. Like fuck it if they like it they like it

Or if a girl is raised feminine but then shows interest in masculine hobbies, trucks or clothes then that shouldn’t be shamed and should be accepted. just because tomboys and tomgirls exist doesn’t mean kids should be raised without gender however. Just because transgender kids do exist doesn’t mean raising kids with gender is wrong

It’s like there’s no one in the middle ground. Like yeah harsh gender roles forced on to a kid is bad and harmful if they don’t like it. Kids that don’t follow typical gender roles shouldn’t be shamed or bullied. But it doesn’t mean gender roles should be forgotten or that they are bad. Doesn’t mean gender roles aren’t important to society

body:
There's something that's honestly downright regressive about all this gender nonsense.    If gender isn't just "biological sex" like it has been for most of my life, but rather some sort of "how society treats you"....   then isn't that stepping away from the idea of treating both sexes equally?      If society treats both genders equally...  and gender is how society treats you (or your "role" in society)... then isn't gender meaningless?    

And the part where they get super-powers of controlling other people's basic language usage or else you're fired is downright tyrannical.  Letting anyone choose to be a protected class at their whim was a very dangerous idea. It attracts all the crazies whose aim is to weaponize it.
body_html:
There's something that's honestly downright regressive about all this gender nonsense. If gender isn't just "biological sex" like it has been for most of my life, but rather some sort of "how society treats you".... then isn't that stepping away from the idea of treating both sexes equally? If society treats both genders equally... and gender is how society treats you (or your "role" in society)... then isn't gender meaningless?

And the part where they get super-powers of controlling other people's basic language usage or else you're fired is downright tyrannical. Letting anyone choose to be a protected class at their whim was a very dangerous idea. It attracts all the crazies whose aim is to weaponize it.

body:
>Gender is an extremely important factor and place of identity

No.  It isn't.  Identity is what you're interested in, what you're passionate about, your goals and dreams in life.  You've been drinking the liberal koolaid a bit too much.  Who you are, as a person, has very very little to do with your genitals.

body: Just because you had or have an obsession doesn't mean it's important for everyone. And children are absolute sponges. They'll pick up on stuff their parents care about.  If you're gender obsessed, that'll spill over into the kid. It's a tough lesson, but it's best if parents don't have mental issues, or at least have managed or come to acceptance of their issues, before having children.
body_html: Just because you had or have an obsession doesn't mean it's important for everyone. And children are absolute sponges. They'll pick up on stuff their parents care about. If you're gender obsessed, that'll spill over into the kid. It's a tough lesson, but it's best if parents don't have mental issues, or at least have managed or come to acceptance of their issues, before having children.

I think children should be raised as their gender assigned at birth. Like if ur a boy you should be raised with typical boy stuff. If the child deviates then that should be accepted but they still need that default gender role presented to them. Almost as a benchmark

Let the child enjoy whatever they enjoy however. If you’re raising a boy and despite being raised masculine they are showing interest in feminine things then let them and celebrate it. Like if they wanna wear dresses, paint their nails or play with barbies. Like fuck it if they like it they like it

Or if a girl is raised feminine but then shows interest in masculine hobbies, trucks or clothes then that shouldn’t be shamed and should be accepted. just because tomboys and tomgirls exist doesn’t mean kids should be raised without gender however. Just because transgender kids do exist doesn’t mean raising kids with gender is wrong

It’s like there’s no one in the middle ground. Like yeah harsh gender roles forced on to a kid is bad and harmful if they don’t like it. Kids that don’t follow typical gender roles shouldn’t be shamed or bullied. But it doesn’t mean gender roles should be forgotten or that they are bad. Doesn’t mean gender roles aren’t important to society
post.title: Choosing to raise a child without a gender should be considered child abuse

body:
If the argument was gender ROLES, then my stance is live however you want, whatever you find to be your thing in life, don't let anyone or anything hold you back.  I think what people are trying to say and aren't successful in saying it is there's a difference between gender and gender expression, which I would agree with.  What your genitals are don't really have much to do with what you're interested in.  Yes, there are typical things like men being into physical jobs and physical labor and women being more into intimate positions in life, but what is typical is not the rule; men usually don't fancy makeup too much but Jeffrey Star and James Charles are makeup gods, and they're biologically male.  

You can express yourself in ways that are stereo-typically feminine, but that doesn't make you a woman.  Same for stereo-typically male things.  The overwhelming majority of guitar players in the world are men, but there are millions of women playing guitar, that doesn't make them men.  The majority of nurses around the world are women, but there are millions of nurses who are men and that doesn't make them women.
body_html:
If the argument was gender ROLES, then my stance is live however you want, whatever you find to be your thing in life, don't let anyone or anything hold you back. I think what people are trying to say and aren't successful in saying it is there's a difference between gender and gender expression, which I would agree with. What your genitals are don't really have much to do with what you're interested in. Yes, there are typical things like men being into physical jobs and physical labor and women being more into intimate positions in life, but what is typical is not the rule; men usually don't fancy makeup too much but Jeffrey Star and James Charles are makeup gods, and they're biologically male.

You can express yourself in ways that are stereo-typically feminine, but that doesn't make you a woman. Same for stereo-typically male things. The overwhelming majority of guitar players in the world are men, but there are millions of women playing guitar, that doesn't make them men. The majority of nurses around the world are women, but there are millions of nurses who are men and that doesn't make them women.

Or if a girl is raised feminine but then shows interest in masculine hobbies, trucks or clothes then that shouldn’t be shamed and should be accepted. just because tomboys and tomgirls exist doesn’t mean kids should be raised without gender however. Just because transgender kids do exist doesn’t mean raising kids with gender is wrong

It’s like there’s no one in the middle ground. Like yeah harsh gender roles forced on to a kid is bad and harmful if they don’t like it. Kids that don’t follow typical gender roles shouldn’t be shamed or bullied. But it doesn’t mean gender roles should be forgotten or that they are bad. Doesn’t mean gender roles aren’t important to society
post.title: Choosing to raise a child without a gender should be considered child abuse

parent.body:
If the argument was gender ROLES, then my stance is live however you want, whatever you find to be your thing in life, don't let anyone or anything hold you back.  I think what people are trying to say and aren't successful in saying it is there's a difference between gender and gender expression, which I would agree with.  What your genitals are don't really have much to do with what you're interested in.  Yes, there are typical things like men being into physical jobs and physical labor and women being more into intimate positions in life, but what is typical is not the rule; men usually don't fancy makeup too much but Jeffrey Star and James Charles are makeup gods, and they're biologically male.  

You can express yourself in ways that are stereo-typically feminine, but that doesn't make you a woman.  Same for stereo-typically male things.  The overwhelming majority of guitar players in the world are men, but there are millions of women playing guitar, that doesn't make them men.  The majority of nurses around the world are women, but there are millions of nurses who are men and that doesn't make them women.

That's just the nature of the voting buttons. It's never been clear if the upvote button is for "I agree, this concept is indeed unpopular" or "I agree with this concept".

Same for downvote. Is it "I find this concept contemptible" or "This concept is held by a majority of people, therefore it is not an unpopular opinion".

As for where I stand on the usage, I downvoted because I think nearly everyone outside the small, but very noisy "gender is a construct" minority is in agreement with your statement.

body:
This dilutes your message. Caring more about the vote count than the message suggests that you aren't interested in the discussion, just the imaginary popularity garnered from it.

If you truly believe in something, the "score" shouldn't matter. I hold a great number of beliefs and opinions that my real-life peers find objectionable or distasteful, but we get along because we focus more on the commonalities and we have more respect for one another for having the moral fiber to engage in discussion on *all* of our beliefs and opinions, not just the ones that are "appropriate for the room".

Build your identity on what you are, not what you think you should be based on others' input. You'll find a great deal more people will respect you as well as less people disliking you, but those that do are more vocal about it.

body:
Sexuality isn't non-existent in children, it's just not a priority for them until puberty. Late stage fetuses explore their genitalia and that generally only stops whilst the infant lacks the coordination to do so outside the confines of the womb.

It's more a curiosity thing than gratification. "Hey if I touch this thing here, it feels good. Ok, good to know. We'll throw that one into the 'study further' file."

post.body:
Raising a kid without a gender is going to fuck them up mentally. And I think it’s very toxic. I can’t even imagine the type of identity issues they are going to grow up with.

I think children should be raised as their gender assigned at birth. Like if ur a boy you should be raised with typical boy stuff. If the child deviates then that should be accepted but they still need that default gender role presented to them. Almost as a benchmark

Let the child enjoy whatever they enjoy however. If you’re raising a boy and despite being raised masculine they are showing interest in feminine things then let them and celebrate it. Like if they wanna wear dresses, paint their nails or play with barbies. Like fuck it if they like it they like it

Or if a girl is raised feminine but then shows interest in masculine hobbies, trucks or clothes then that shouldn’t be shamed and should be accepted. just because tomboys and tomgirls exist doesn’t mean kids should be raised without gender however. Just because transgender kids do exist doesn’t mean raising kids with gender is wrong

It’s like there’s no one in the middle ground. Like yeah harsh gender roles forced on to a kid is bad and harmful if they don’t like it. Kids that don’t follow typical gender roles shouldn’t be shamed or bullied. But it doesn’t mean gender roles should be forgotten or that they are bad. Doesn’t mean gender roles aren’t important to society

parent.body:
This dilutes your message. Caring more about the vote count than the message suggests that you aren't interested in the discussion, just the imaginary popularity garnered from it.

If you truly believe in something, the "score" shouldn't matter. I hold a great number of beliefs and opinions that my real-life peers find objectionable or distasteful, but we get along because we focus more on the commonalities and we have more respect for one another for having the moral fiber to engage in discussion on *all* of our beliefs and opinions, not just the ones that are "appropriate for the room".

Build your identity on what you are, not what you think you should be based on others' input. You'll find a great deal more people will respect you as well as less people disliking you, but those that do are more vocal about it.

body:
My mother always argues with me that raising boys as men and girls as women is sexist. She uses examples like "why do schools have separate subjects for boys and girls? Where boys are taught how to make furniture or tools out of wood and girls are taught how to cook and take care of babies." Maybe because it works better that way. Maybe woman's body is not built for chopping wood and carrying heavy logs.
And since men are unable to give birth and unable to breast-feed we shouldn't need to learn how to take care of our babies at such early stage as women. I am not against men and women deviating away from their sex/gender roles but then you have another problem. Men that are behave in feminine way are not attractive to most women and vice-versa. They will have very difficult time finding a long term partner. It can reach a point where they become clinically depressed.

Raising a kid without a gender is going to fuck them up mentally. And I think it’s very toxic. I can’t even imagine the type of identity issues they are going to grow up with.

Like if they wanna wear dresses, paint their nails or play with barbies. Like fuck it if they like it they like it

Doesn’t mean gender roles aren’t important to society

parent.body: Your gender and identity are two completely different things and don't tie into one another.  Who I am as a person, a musician, a gamer, a tech, have NOTHING to do with my genitals.  I know plenty of women who are also musicians, or gamers, or techs.

post.body:
Raising a kid without a gender is going to fuck them up mentally. And I think it’s very toxic. I can’t even imagine the type of identity issues they are going to grow up with.

I think children should be raised as their gender assigned at birth. Like if ur a boy you should be raised with typical boy stuff. If the child deviates then that should be accepted but they still need that default gender role presented to them. Almost as a benchmark

Let the child enjoy whatever they enjoy however. If you’re raising a boy and despite being raised masculine they are showing interest in feminine things then let them and celebrate it. Like if they wanna wear dresses, paint their nails or play with barbies. Like fuck it if they like it they like it

Or if a girl is raised feminine but then shows interest in masculine hobbies, trucks or clothes then that shouldn’t be shamed and should be accepted. just because tomboys and tomgirls exist doesn’t mean kids should be raised without gender however. Just because transgender kids do exist doesn’t mean raising kids with gender is wrong

It’s like there’s no one in the middle ground. Like yeah harsh gender roles forced on to a kid is bad and harmful if they don’t like it. Kids that don’t follow typical gender roles shouldn’t be shamed or bullied. But it doesn’t mean gender roles should be forgotten or that they are bad. Doesn’t mean gender roles aren’t important to society

body:
The academics are the ones who were paid to write that shit.  

https://thefederalist.com/2019/10/15/why-sex-and-gender-are-not-two-different-things/

The Meaning of Words
The word sex has not really been in contention until the Supreme Court deliberations. Few contest that it refers to biological male and female as well as to the act itself. Gender is where most of the excitement is. So let’s start where any reasonable discussion of the real meaning of a word must start, looking at its specific etymology. In doing so, we find gender has everything to do with the first, most basic, and natural fact of being human.

From the 14th century, gender has referred to the essence of what male and female are, issuing from the Proto-Indo-European root gen- or gene-. It fundamentally references the creation, birth, and begetting of new human beings, as in, to generate or engender.

This root is also interestingly associated with the Latin gonos, from which we get our English word gonad. Of course, these are the uniquely determinative, wholly binary parts of our anatomy that cannot do what they do without their cooperative union with the body of the other gender. Gender refers to that which is inherently heterosexual.

Thus, gender’s grammatical root—gene/gen—is also associated with such words as genesis, generation (both in terms of being generated as well as the historical time-frame one was generated) and yes, of course, genitals, those two unavoidably binary parts of the human anatomy that help our gonads and associated cooperative parts do what gonads do: generate. Finally, gender also derives from the Latin genus meaning race, kin, family, kind, order, and species, that generative line from which another comes and thus belongs to.

If anything is the furthest thing from being a mere social construct, gender is. So the words “sex” and “gender” are indeed two objective sides of the same coin. Anyone who says differently is just making stuff up. This is precisely what the gender theorists are doing. Next we must address gender theory’s “creative” relationship with science.

https://www.etymonline.com/word/*gene-?ref=etymonline_crossreference

https://www.etymonline.com/search?q=gonads

"nearly no one employed the word until the late 1970s. But the surprising finding was what academic disciplines did and did not adopt it. Only the softer sociological, humanities, and psychiatric disciplines started using “gender” in the late ‘70s and in immediately increasing numbers. The harder, natural sciences were far less likely to use the word and not likely to attach any new meaning to it.

When asked, those scholars working in the biological and natural sciences who did use the term in greater numbers reported doing so for the following three reasons: 1) to “signal sympathy with feminist goals,” 2) to use a more in vogue, academic-sounding term, or 3) linguistically to avoid the connotation of copulation."

Feminism, the movement that has completely destroyed male and female relationships in every aspect, is the reason for this absolute bullshit that is based on ideologies and NOT science.

post.body:
Raising a kid without a gender is going to fuck them up mentally. And I think it’s very toxic. I can’t even imagine the type of identity issues they are going to grow up with.

I think children should be raised as their gender assigned at birth. Like if ur a boy you should be raised with typical boy stuff. If the child deviates then that should be accepted but they still need that default gender role presented to them. Almost as a benchmark

Let the child enjoy whatever they enjoy however. If you’re raising a boy and despite being raised masculine they are showing interest in feminine things then let them and celebrate it. Like if they wanna wear dresses, paint their nails or play with barbies. Like fuck it if they like it they like it

Or if a girl is raised feminine but then shows interest in masculine hobbies, trucks or clothes then that shouldn’t be shamed and should be accepted. just because tomboys and tomgirls exist doesn’t mean kids should be raised without gender however. Just because transgender kids do exist doesn’t mean raising kids with gender is wrong

It’s like there’s no one in the middle ground. Like yeah harsh gender roles forced on to a kid is bad and harmful if they don’t like it. Kids that don’t follow typical gender roles shouldn’t be shamed or bullied. But it doesn’t mean gender roles should be forgotten or that they are bad. Doesn’t mean gender roles aren’t important to society
